headline.main: Four Invaded Nations Plan a Bloc For Economic Unity After the War; Poland, Czecho-Slovakia, Yugoslavia and Greece Propose Buffer Area Against Germany, Also Own Rehabilitation

lead_paragraph: Formation of a bloc of nations to function as an economic unit after the war, embracing Poland, Czecho-Slovakia, Yugoslavia and Greece, has been determined upon by the delegations of those countries to the conference of the International Labor Organization, it was learned yesterday.
abstract: ILO delegations representing Poland, Czecho-Slovakia, Yugoslavia and Greece plan post-war bloc for econ unity and as buffer against Germany; Bulgarian, Rumanian and Hungarian adherence provided

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
